# How to Publish Enterprise Apps Built with Workspace ONE

Last updated April 27, 2023 by Appdome

This Knowledge Base article explains how to publish enterprise apps built with Workspace ONE using Appdome.

### Complete the following steps BEFORE you can Deploy Mobile Apps Integrated with VMware Workspace ONE:

* Your mobile app is [fused](https://www.appdome.com/dev-sec-blog/make-android-ios-apps-work-workspace-one/) with the VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) SDK.
* Your mobile app is [signed](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-app-security/no-code-mobile-app-security/how-to-sign-my-app-on-appdome/).
* You have a configured and accessible instance of VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) UEM or Workspace One.

## The Easy Steps to Publish Enterprise Apps Built with Workspace ONE

Upload Your Fused App to VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) Console

1. Navigate to the **VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) UEM Console** within your web browser and Log in.

2. Go to *A*. **Apps & Books** –> *B*. **Applications** –> *C*. **Native**

3. Click **Add Application**.

![Deploying VMware Workspace ONE (AirWatch)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_uploadApp__1-170x105.png)

4. On the opened window, click **Upload**.

![Deploying VMware Workspace ONE (AirWatch) ](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_uploadApp__2-768x273.png)

5. Click**Choose File** to browse the app file.

6. Click **Save**.

![Deploying VMware Workspace ONE (AirWatch) ](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_uploadApp__3-768x373.png)

7. Wait for the upload to finish.

![Deploying VMware Workspace ONE (AirWatch) ](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_uploadApp__4-170x172.png)

8. When the upload is done, click **Continue**.

![Deploying VMware Workspace ONE (AirWatch) ](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_uploadApp__5-170x152.png)

9. The application edit page will open. You can configure the app’s basic set up here. If you want to apply a specific security profile to the app, you can do it under **More–>SDK** (see **Manage VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch)** **Security Policies**, below). Configure the app and click **Save & Assign**.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_uploadApp__6.png)

### Assign the App to Users or Devices

\* The Assignment window will open automatically after clicking Save & Assign. It can also be opened manually to change the assignment for existing apps by opening the apps page and clicking **Assign**.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_assign_0-768x285.png)

1. Click **Add Assignment**

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_AssignApp_1-768x562.png)

2. Start typing the group name in **Select Assignment Groups** and select the desired group.

3. Choose the **App Delivery Method**.

4. Enter **Deployment Begins On** a date.

5. You can turn on basic **Policies for Managed Access**, **App Tunneling** and **Application Configuration** to the app.

6. Click **Add**.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_AssignApp_2-768x626.png)

7. Back on the assignment window, the new assignment is added. Click **Save and Publish**.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_AssignApp_3-768x625.png)

8. The Preview Assigned Devices shows a list of devices that will be assigned the new app. Click **Publish**.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_AssignApp_4-768x626.png)

You’re done! your app will now be available in the App Catalog of the assigned device. You can read more about using the [VMware AirWatch Catalog](https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/2001/Application_Management/GUID-AWT-FLEX-DPLYMNT-ADD.html#GUID-AWT-FLEX-DPLYMNT-ADD) in the VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) Knowledge Base.

### Manage VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) Security Policies

VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) UEM uses several mechanisms to deploy and assign policies to users, devices or apps. Here you’ll learn how to use VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) to configure the default app Security Policy and add new Profiles – which can be assigned to app deferentially.

1. Go to A. **Apps & Books** –> B. **Application Settings**–> C. **Default Policy**.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_Policy_1-768x304.png)

2. Select Override, if you want to change the default policy. This page had the control that will manage apps by default. You can manage various controls, such as:

1. **Authentication Type.**
2. **App Tunnel.**
3. **Data Loss Prevention**, etc.

3. To save changes, click **Save.**

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_Policy_2-768x639.png)

4. To Create a non-default profile, click **Profiles** in the left side menu.

5. Click **Add Profile**.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_Policy_3-768x399.png)

6. Select **SDK Profile**.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_Policy_4-768x366.png)

7. Select the desired **Platform**.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_Policy_5-768x305.png)

8. Name the **Profile**

9. **Configure** the Security Profile. A. Configure Data Loss Prevention under **Restrictions**, Configure the App Tunnel under Proxy. You can read more about the [Default SDK Security Settings](https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/1811/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM-Mobile-Device-Management-Documentation/GUID-AWT-MANTYPES.html) and [SDK Profiles, Policies and Settings Compatibility](https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/9.7/vmware-airwatch-guides-97/GUID-AW97-SDK_Custom_Browser.html) in the VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) Knowledge Base.

10. Click **Save**.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_Policy_6-768x605.png)

### Apply an SDK Profile to an App in VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) UEM

1. Go to *A*. **Apps & Books** –> *B*. **Applications** –> *C*. **Native**

2. Click the **Application’s Name**.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_assignedProfile_1-768x436.png)

3. Click **Edit**

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_assignedProfile_2-768x283.png)

4. On the Edit Application window, click *A*. **More** –> *B*. **SDK**.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_assignedProfile_3-768x552.png)

5. Select **SDK Profile** you want to apply to the app.

6. Click **Save & Assign**.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_assignedProfile_4-768x686.png)

7. If you don’t want to change the assignment, click **Save an Publish**. Otherwise, you can update the app’s assignment.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_assignedProfile_5-768x685.png)

8. Review the assigned devices and click **Publish**.

![](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/AW_assignedProfile_6-768x684.png)

The new profile will now be pushed to the assigned devices, and on the next launch of the app, it will conform to the new profile’s security policy.

You are now ready to start deploying mobile apps Fused with the VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) SDK.

### How Do I Learn More?

To learn about Device Enrollment with VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) : [iOS](https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/1907/UEM_Managing_Devices/GUID-AWT-DEVICEENROLLMENTOVERVIEW.html), [Android](https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/1907/UEM_Managing_Devices/GUID-AWT-DEVICEENROLLMENTOVERVIEW.html)

To learn about configuring security policies in VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) UEM, read [Default SDK Security Settings](https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/1811/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM-Mobile-Device-Management-Documentation/GUID-AWT-MANTYPES.html) and [SDK Profiles, Policies and Settings Compatibility](https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/9.7/vmware-airwatch-guides-97/GUID-AW97-SDK_Custom_Browser.html) in the AirWatch Knowledge Base.

To learn about configuring the VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) Catalog, read this article in the VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) Knowledge Base.

To zoom out on this topic, deploying mobile apps Fused with the VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) SDK, read the [Appdome for VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) datasheet](/enterprise-mobile-apps/uem-mam-sdks/vmware-workspace-one/)on our website.

To make sure your app is properly fused with VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) SDK, check out: [Use Appdome to Integrate VMWare Workspace ONE (AirWatch) SDKs to any Mobile App](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/byod-zero-trust/no-code-vmware-workspace-one/make-android-ios-apps-work-workspace-one/).

Thanks for visiting [Appdome](https://www.appdome.com)! Our mission is to make mobile integration easy. We hope we’re living up to the mission with your project. If you don’t already have an account, you can [sign up for free](https://fusion.appdome.com/).
